org.smpp

Class WrongSessionStateException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • org.smpp.SmppException
          • org.smpp.WrongSessionStateException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class WrongSessionStateException
extends SmppException
    Exception WrongSessionStateException is thrown if a Session's method which requires certain state of the session but the session is not in the state. Examples are submitting a message when the session is bound as a receiver or if method for receiving is called when the session is bound as transmitter.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.2 $
    Author:
    Logica Mobile Networks SMPP Open Source Team
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • WrongSessionStateException

        public WrongSessionStateException(int sessionType,
                                  int expectedState,
                                  int currentState)
        Initializes the exception with details about the session.
        Parameters:
        sessionType - the type of the session i.e. if it's session used in ESME or in MC
        expectedState - the state expected for the requested session operation
        currentState - the state the sesion was in when the state was checked

    • Method Detail

      • getMessage

        public String getMessage()
        Construct the message carried by the excpetion according the details provided to the exception's constructor.
        Overrides:
        getMessage in class Throwable
        Returns:
        the exception's message string describing the reason for the exception

      • getStateDescription

        public static String getStateDescription(int state)
        Returns the textual representation of the passed state. Can handle multiple states, e.g. for value "STATE_OPENED | STATE_CLOSED" returns string "closed, opened".
        Parameters:
        state - the state whose description has to be returned
        Returns:
        string containing list of textual representations of the state

      • getStateDescription

        public static String getStateDescription(int state,
                                         int testState,
                                         String currentDescr,
                                         String descr)
        Returns value of descr if the state and testState have at least one of the bits equaly set to 1. Uses currentDescr for checking if the returned string should be prefixed with comma.
        Parameters:
        state - the state value you probe
        testState - the state constant for which you provide descr
        currentDescr - if you are concatenating descriptions, pass the previously gained description here
        descr - the textual description of the state
        Returns:
        descr if the state contains testState, empty string otherwise
